snippet: When a Long Island maître d’hôtel saw a man later identified as the date of the groom’s niece holding the box, a confrontation, a chase and an arrest followed.
abstract: Omar Santiago of Irvington, NJ, is arrested on charges of grand larceny after he is caught trying to leave a wedding at the West Sayville Country Club on Long Island with cash and checks intended for the newlyweds; Santiago was attending the wedding as the date of the groom's niece.
lead_paragraph: When a Long Island maître d’hôtel saw a man later identified as the date of the groom’s niece holding the box, a confrontation, a chase and an arrest followed.

headline.seo: Guest at Long Island Wedding Is Charged With Grand Larceny
headline.main: After Wedding, Money Box Is the Something Borrowed
headline.print_headline: After Wedding, Money Box Is the Something Borrowed
